parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Serial Port
parameter.description: Set the serial port used to access the Z-Wave stick

parameter.name: controller_master
parameter.label: Controller is Master
parameter.description:
This controller is the master controller in the network.
The binding will perform automatic configuration of the network. This setting should be set to true unless you have another controller that is required to run the network.

parameter.name: controller_suc
parameter.label: Controller is SUC
parameter.description: Controller is SUC and will receive updates from other controllers in the network

parameter.name: controller_inclusiontimeout
parameter.label: Inclusion Mode Timeout
parameter.description: Sets the amount of time the controller will keep inclusion and exclusion mode enabled.

parameter.name: controller_softreset
parameter.label: Soft Reset Controller
parameter.description: Resets the Z-Wave stick - similar to removing the stick from the USB.

parameter.name: controller_hardreset
parameter.label: Hard Reset Controller
parameter.description: Hard resets the Z-Wave stick - this will erase all configuration from the controller!

parameter.name: controller_exclude
parameter.label: Exclude Devices
parameter.description: Puts the controller into Exclusion mode.

parameter.name: controller_sync
parameter.label: Synchronize network
parameter.description: Download the network with the SUC

parameter.name: inclusion_mode
parameter.label: Inclusion Mode
parameter.description:
Set the controller inclusion mode

Low Power Inclusion

In this mode, the device to be included must be brought close to the controller – normally the device must be within a meter or so of the controller. Low Power Inclusion may be required for some older devices.

High Power Inclusion

In this mode, the controller and the device will use their nominal RF power, so they can be included into the network anywhere so long as the device can directly communicate with the controller. This would normally mean the device can be within 10 to 15m of the controller, however this will depend on the environment and it could require a shorter distance.

Network Wide Inclusion

In this mode, the controller uses high power, but also other devices within the network can route the inclusion messages within the mesh network. This means that devices can be included in their final location even if they are not in direct communication with the controller. This mode will only work when the routing devices also support NWI – generally this can be considered when the devices are Z-Wave Plus compatible.

parameter.name: security_inclusionmode
parameter.label: Secure Inclusion Mode
parameter.description:
Sets the controller secure inclusion mode

All Devices

In this mode, all devices reporting the SECURITY command class will be securely included into the network.
This may reduce the life of battery devices and slow down communications. For most devices, it is not necesary to include the device securely into the network since the same command classes can be used without security.

Entry Control Devices

In this mode, only Entry Control Devices such as locks will be securely included into the network.
